Description: Lower body sherd of large Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed streaky black (mostly worn); exterior, from top; part of undetermined motif; wide band; chain of lotus flowers and buds. Joining sherd has band and line below, and trace of perhaps rays.
Curator's comments: Lemos identifies the sherd as coming from an oinochoe, but the interior decoration points to the sherd as coming from an open vessel. The sherd joins British Museum 1965,0930.300 and belongs to the same vase as British Museum 1924,1201.522. For parallels, see Lemos no. 114 from Emporio and no. 124 from Rizari. Lotus flower and lotus bud chains are not uncommon decorations on the lower body of Chian Wild goat Style chalices.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 249, no. 342)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0175) (phase 2)
